reviewText: The WWE needs to stop making so many dvds and think about fans. The release dvds over stars that have been there barely two years like Rey Mistero Jr and Brock Lesnar. Anther problem is they release dvds of stars but it lacks alot of matchs that made these people famous such as Shawn Micheals disappointing dvd (which lacks his Rocker, 92-93, and DX days) and Hulk Hogan's dvd looks cool but most of the matchs I have on anther tape and the ones I dont are terriable. The question is if WWE owns WCW and WWE, then why the hell do they put out such so-so dvds? They need to reconize the older stars like Shawn Micheals, Bret Hart, and Undertaker, stars people love and remember. Then make a 5 dvd (or more) set for each superstar with the first years, middle, and last years..i gurantee it'll sell. Please Vince, think about it.
summary: Will WWE ever stop screwing around?

reviewText: I have to admit that this video is one of the most candid interviews with one of the icons of the WWF to date. It has The Undertaker in is human side as well as his comments on his career to date. This is a must have for someone who loves the former Ministry of Darkness leader. If you have it, do not sell it, it is excellent viewing

reviewText: This shows you everything from the undertakers first Time he set foot in the ring and how he got interseted and exposed to the WWE to his career fighting Triple H at Wrestlemania X-7 in an awesome brutal match (one of my favorites).This is a way better DVD then his last Undertaker "The Phenom" DVD which only showed matches(which was also pretty cool that they did that but I still like the other DVD set up much better)and no behind the scenes footage or the undertaker's opinion on the matches!DVD Extras-Undertaker vs. Shawn Michaels (Badd Blood 97')Undertaker vs. Kane (Wrestlemania 98')Undertaker vs. Kane (Unforgiven '98)Undertaker vs. Kurt Angle (Fully Loaded '00)Undertaker vs. Triple H (Wrestlemania '01)(these are all full matches)and exclusive bonus Interviews!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This one is a keeper. Not only does it do a good bio on The Undertaker but it also features additional interviews and five of his all-time great matches.Only two real weak spots in my view. No mention of his feud with The Ultimate Warrior! I feel that was a big focal point of Mark Calloway's early career as The Undertaker and a key feud that helped him become noticed as UW was a big star second to only Hulk Hogan at that point in the early 90's.The other was the additional matches. While I did like them, I wished they would've shown one of his old matches from WCW. In particular, his match with then U.S. Champion Lex Luger at The Great American Bash '90. Though Luger won that match, UT was pretty dominant during most of it. Would've been fun to see him back in his "Mean" Mark Callous days!Other than that, it is a recommended piece of video to pick up!
summary: One Of The Better WWE Profiles
Title: N/A

reviewText: Usually I don't buy WWF's DVD's due to lack of extra's but in this case it highlights one of the all time greats, The Undertaker.Going into this title I didn't know what to expect. Would I see more Taker's current status or would I see the Phenom? What I got was a perfect combination of old and new. We actually get to see highlights Undertaker starting out as "Mean Mark". The video itself is outstanding with commentary by superstars such as Kurt Angel, Chris Jericho, Kane, Paul Heyman and good ol' Jim Ross. This DVD also delivers in extra's. Finally, a DVD that includes Michaels VS. Taker as well as the inferno match with Kane.while I do indeed miss Undertaker's darker days, it's intreasting to see how he has evolved. It's also intreasting to just see Undertaker sit down and talk about his life and all that he has done. I had seen so much WCW when I was little and it wasn't until about 1991 (I was still little) that I actually began watching WWF. When I came in Undertaker and Hogan were fueding and so this DVD brings back tons of memories for yours truly. If your the least bit of an Undertaker fan then this is a really worth while DVD that is sure to please. In my view it truly does show that Undertaker is a living legend.-Jason Glasco

reviewText: I thought it was a cool dvd. It has a few clips from his WCW days as 'Mean' Mark Callous.In WCW he was managed by both Paul E. Dangerously and current WWE ref, Theodore 'Teddy' Long. It shows him outside the ring and arena. It has part of his HIAC match with Mankind, Fully Loaded match with Kurt Angle, WM14 and Inferno match with Kane. Undertaker is a true locker-room leader. Comments made by Kane, Brooklyn Brawler, Paul Heyman, J.R., Matt Hardy, Edge, Earl Hebner and Howard Finkle. Jericho admits that he should be more carefull about the things he says to some of the boys in the back. The bonus featres include several of the matches named above as well as the first HIAC with HBK and his WM X-7 match with HHH. The only thing that disapionted me about the WM X-7 match was the ref being out cold for most of the brawl. I was a little shocked to find that his match with Mankind at KOTR in HIAC was not part of the bonus features. It has his fueds with HBK,Kurt Angle and Kane. The tape also includes clips from his match with Hogan at S.Series 1991. I hope the next Hogan/Undertaker match will be just the two of them, no Flair and no Vince McMahon just the two of them.DVD Extrasvs.HBK HIAC '97vs.Kane WM14vs.Kane Unforgiven(Inferno match)'98vs.Kurt Angle Fully Loaded '00vs.Triple H WrestleMania X-7I have always had alot of respect for the Undertaker because he changes with the times and his new Wrestle Mania is 11 and 0, with A-Train and Big Slow being the latsest of the  Undertaker's Wrestle Mania victoms. Plus he is 6'10", over 300 lbs. and moves around the ring like a real athlete.
summary: It's Undertaker's yard and he runs it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are a huge Undertaker fan, like I am, then you'll love this DVD.  The Undertaker is a very private person, and there's not a lot known about his private life.  So, it's pretty cool that in this DVD you get to see a little of his house in Tampa, FL, as well as some of his motorcycles.  There's also a some segments that include Sara (his wife) and Undertaker even shows and talks about some of his awesome tatoos. For me, the best part of the whole thing is just seeing Undertaker talking about and being himself.  This DVD doesn't really get much into Undertaker's history; it more deals with his present-day "Badass" incarnation- tho there is some interesting footage of a young Undertaker wrestling as Mean Mark Callous in the beginning.  Also included are some great extras, such as the first "Hell in a Cell" match against Sean Micheals.  All in all, well worth the...price tag for fans of the Phenom.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Since WWF has scarfed up WCW and the rights to its video library we get to see Taker from his televised begining with a "SLIM" Paul E. in WCW.  It doesn't get into much of the Taker of the Phenom type.  Of course he goes over BIG vistory's like Hogan, but it really gets into the scuzbag biker we know as Deadman Inc.  The best part of this video is the way the other performers don't perform in interviews, except for Hayman I think he doesn't know the difference anymore...either that or he just lives wrestling threw ever facet of his existance.  Now teh main attraction isnt really that great, but the DVD extras sure are.  Foremost you get the HELL IN THE CELL between him and Shawn Michaels which is impossible to find on DVD.  You could find it on Rampage 97 but its deluted.  If you have never seen this match you are deprived as Michaels is at his best and is pretty much his last really great performance watching you find out why as he pretty much ends his career in the match, if anyone saw the night after RAW taping he looked like crap.  But this is the match is one of the brutalest things I've ever seen.
summary: HELL IN THE CELL SELLS THIS VIDEO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: I purchased the VHS version of this and being a huge Undertaker fan was happy I did! You not only get to see some highlights of Taker matches, you also get to see and hear what his co-workers and fellow superstars think of him. Undertaker is highly respected in WWE. Also you get to see him and his wife, Sara,backstage and also at home. Sara speaks briefly on the tape. The only thing that I was disappointed with is, the interview with Undertaker wasn't as broad as I would have liked. I wish more questions were answered: Who does he really like wrestling against? Who are his favorite stars to watch? Stars he didn't get along with? etc, and the interview obviously could have been longer. Other than that I was pleased with the tape. Undertaker remains my favorite superstar. No one does it better.

reviewText: This DVD chronicles how the Dead Man became a WWE Icon. Ever since he came at Survivor series over a decade ago he has feuded with all the great superstars, and has beaten them. This is the story of how he started as the Phenom, and became the American Bada**.The extras include several matches from his career, and they are all watchable, allthough some you should only watch once in a while.Undertaker vs. Shawn Michales: This is whithout a doubt, one of the best classics ever seen in the WWE. The first ever Hell in a Cell match and it didn't dissapoint. The Undertaker dominated Shawn during most of this match, and it really started to heat up as they got out of the cell. Even the interference didn't ruin this match, allthough it was a real shocker.  10/10Undertaker vs. Kurt Angle: This was an okay match. Kurt didn't stand a chance and it showed in the match. Funny moment when he came out on a small bike compared to Undertakers huge bike. 8/10Undertaker vs. Kane: This was the first time Undertaker and Kane would fight, and in my opinion it was their best match up. The Undertaker's entrance was awsome with the druids holding up the torches. It was also cool when the Undertaker leaped over the top rope and crashed right onto the announce table. Awsome ending with three tombstones! 10/10The Undertaker vs. Kane: This was the first and only inferno match so far where the entire ring was surrounded by fire. You could feel the heat just by looking at the fire. When Kane's arm caught on fire it was like a torch was lit. 10/10The Undertaker vs. Triple H: This was an awsome match at wrestlmania 17. The ref was unconscious during most of this match which allowed them to really take it to the limit. The Undertaker even chokeslams Triple H over the side of a monitor tower. Even Triple H's sledgehammer couldn't help him. 9/10This DVd was awsome, and the matches were worth it, so go out and buy it.
summary: Just barely under a 5 star rating

reviewText: OMG....I am honored to be writing this review.No one has any idea just how much.I am a diehard TAKER fanatic to the max and I not only own this on VHS but also on DvD.I exremely recommend this in any form you can get your hands on especially if you are a Taker fan.It is fabulous and one of the best I have seen involving The UnderTaker.The entire dvd shows Mark Callaway "TAKER" talking about how he got started as a wrestler when he was one of the Skyscrapers then as he evolved into The UnderTaker and was introduced into WWF/WWE on Nov 22,1990 at the Survivor Series.It is a very intimate and candid story ,one that will not disappoint any Taker fan.The man is totally awesome in every way in and out of the ring.He offers  an extremely honest biography.The dvd has some rare footage of him in his younger days and up to 2001-2002 .There are bonus matches with The Phenom against these opponents: Kurt Angle,Shawn Michaels "HBK", Kane, Triple H, plus some exclusive interviews.The entire story so far is told by the Dead Man himself .It shows the 2 faces of Taker from the beginning as Taker, American Bad Ass, The Ministry and Taker more recently.There are some classic battles betweenhim and Hulk Hogan,Stone Cold Steve Austin, Diamond Dallas Page and Mankind.The whole thing is atleast 3 hours long and shows Taker in his private life with some footage of his wife Sara at home and Taker with his Harleys.Please do yourself a favor and get this any way you can.It is overly worth every penny you will spend.I own almost every Taker DVD and this one out beats them all.I have since his first appearance and will always love this man and his character beyond belief.There are no words to describe how I feel.So if any of you are at all Taker freaks,buy this.
summary: I BOW TO THE PHENOM!!!!! RIP
